paper_abstract: In this study, a procedure is proposed for damage identification and discrimination for composite materials based on acoustic emission signals clustering using artificial neural networks. An unsupervised methodology based on the self-organizing map of Kohonen is developed. The methodology is described and applied to a cross-ply glass-fibre/polyester laminate submitted to a tensile test. Six different AE waveforms were identified. Hence, the damage sequence has been identified from the modal nature of the AE waves. (c) 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Health monitoring of FRP using acoustic emission and artificial neural networks
